chapter.keywords: online king james holy bible, king james bible, bible todo list, words of Jesus, bible index, the authorised version, KJV, KJB, KJAV, AV

items.text: Man that is born of a woman is of few days, and full of trouble.
items.plainText: Man that is born of a woman is of few days, and full of trouble.

items.text: He cometh forth like a flower, and is cut down: he fleeth also as a shadow, and continueth not.
items.plainText: He cometh forth like a flower, and is cut down: he fleeth also as a shadow, and continueth not.

items.text: And dost thou open thine eyes upon such an one, and bringest me into judgment with thee?
items.plainText: And dost thou open thine eyes upon such an one, and bringest me into judgment with thee?

items.text: Who can bring a clean thing out of an unclean? not one.
items.plainText: Who can bring a clean thing out of an unclean? not one.

items.text: Seeing his days are determined, the number of his months are with thee, thou hast appointed his bounds that he cannot pass;
items.plainText: Seeing his days are determined, the number of his months are with thee, thou hast appointed his bounds that he cannot pass;

items.text: Turn from him, that he may rest, till he shall accomplish, as an hireling, his day.
items.plainText: Turn from him, that he may rest, till he shall accomplish, as an hireling, his day.

items.text: For there is hope of a tree, if it be cut down, that it will sprout again, and that the tender branch thereof will not cease.
items.plainText: For there is hope of a tree, if it be cut down, that it will sprout again, and that the tender branch thereof will not cease.

items.text: Though the root thereof wax old in the earth, and the stock thereof die in the ground;
items.plainText: Though the root thereof wax old in the earth, and the stock thereof die in the ground;

items.text: Yet through the scent of water it will bud, and bring forth boughs like a plant.
items.plainText: Yet through the scent of water it will bud, and bring forth boughs like a plant.

items.text: But man dieth, and wasteth away: yea, man giveth up the ghost, and where is he?
items.plainText: But man dieth, and wasteth away: yea, man giveth up the ghost, and where is he?

items.text: As the waters fail from the sea, and the flood decayeth and drieth up:
items.plainText: As the waters fail from the sea, and the flood decayeth and drieth up:

items.text: So man lieth down, and riseth not: till the heavens be no more, they shall not awake, nor be raised out of their sleep.
items.plainText: So man lieth down, and riseth not: till the heavens be no more, they shall not awake, nor be raised out of their sleep.

items.text: O that thou wouldest hide me in the grave, that thou wouldest keep me secret, until thy wrath be past, that thou wouldest appoint me a set time, and remember me!
items.plainText: O that thou wouldest hide me in the grave, that thou wouldest keep me secret, until thy wrath be past, that thou wouldest appoint me a set time, and remember me!

items.text: If a man die, shall he live again? all the days of my appointed time will I wait, till my change come.
items.plainText: If a man die, shall he live again? all the days of my appointed time will I wait, till my change come.

items.text: Thou shalt call, and I will answer thee: thou wilt have a desire to the work of thine hands.
items.plainText: Thou shalt call, and I will answer thee: thou wilt have a desire to the work of thine hands.

items.text: For now thou numberest my steps: dost thou not watch over my sin?
items.plainText: For now thou numberest my steps: dost thou not watch over my sin?

items.text: My transgression is sealed up in a bag, and thou sewest up mine iniquity.
items.plainText: My transgression is sealed up in a bag, and thou sewest up mine iniquity.

items.text: And surely the mountain falling cometh to nought, and the rock is removed out of his place.
items.plainText: And surely the mountain falling cometh to nought, and the rock is removed out of his place.

items.text: The waters wear the stones: thou washest away the things which grow out of the dust of the earth; and thou destroyest the hope of man.
items.plainText: The waters wear the stones: thou washest away the things which grow out of the dust of the earth; and thou destroyest the hope of man.

items.text: Thou prevailest for ever against him, and he passeth: thou changest his countenance, and sendest him away.
items.plainText: Thou prevailest for ever against him, and he passeth: thou changest his countenance, and sendest him away.

items.text: His sons come to honour, and he knoweth it not; and they are brought low, but he perceiveth it not of them.
items.plainText: His sons come to honour, and he knoweth it not; and they are brought low, but he perceiveth it not of them.

items.text: But his flesh upon him shall have pain, and his soul within him shall mourn.
items.plainText: But his flesh upon him shall have pain, and his soul within him shall mourn.
